title: Child Rights: Faith leaders and Unicef join hands to champion child rights | Patna News - Times of India
text: Patna: Prominent faith and spiritual leaders on Thursday came together on a common platform, pledging to ensure that children in Bihar have their rights to survival, growth, development, protection, and participation fulfilled, with a particular focus on the most marginalized and vulnerable children. This meeting marked the revival of the Bihar Interfaith Forum for Children (BIFC), initiated in 2017 and active till the global pandemic.Over 20 faith leaders along with other representatives of Faith-Based Organisations (FBOs), media and UNICEF officials attended a panel discussion on \"Advancing Childrenâ€™s Rights in Bihar\" organised here on Thursday.During her speech, Margaret Gwada, the chief of field office for UNICEF Bihar, highlighted the 75-year journey of UNICEF in India and the unwavering support of faith leaders and their organisations. She stated, \"Our history demonstrates that together, we can accomplish what we set our minds and hearts to, whether it's eradicating polio or combating the global pandemic of Covid.\"Other participants in the panel discussion included Prof Sayyad Shah Shamim Ahmad from Khanqah Muneemiya, Mufti Sohrab Nadwi Qasmi from Emarat E Shariya, Md Shahzad from Jamat E Islami, Acharya Kishore Kunal from Mahavir Nayas Samiti, B K Sarita from Brahmakumaris, SK Parida from ISKON, Alok Kumar Agrawal and Pragya Agrawal from Art of Living, Dilip Singh from Takhat Sri Harimandir Sahib Ji (Patna Sahib), Vijay Kumar Jain, and Jain Mandir (Patna).We also published the following articles recentlyBihar will improve by winning elections with right people: Prashant KishorPoll strategist Prashant Kishor emphasized the need for Bihar's reformation through elections with the right candidates, not just winning.
